Class RandomBrickGenerator

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.logic.bricks.RandomBrickGenerator
All Implemented Interfaces:
BrickGenerator
public class RandomBrickGenerator extends Object implements BrickGenerator
A concrete implementation of BrickGenerator that provides a fair sequence of pieces.

Algorithm: The 7-Bag System
Instead of pure randomness (which could lead to "piece droughts"), this class implements the standard "Bag" randomizer used in modern Tetris games.

  • A "bag" is filled with one of each of the 7 Tetrominoes.
  • The bag is shuffled.
  • Pieces are drawn from the bag until empty, then a new bag is created.

This ensures that a player will never go more than 12 turns without seeing a specific piece.

  • Constructor Details

    • RandomBrickGenerator

      public RandomBrickGenerator()
      Constructs a new generator and pre-fills the queue. Ensures that the game starts with a full set of upcoming pieces ready for the View.

  • Method Details

    • getNextBrickFromBag

      private Brick getNextBrickFromBag()
      Refills the internal bag if empty and draws the next piece.

      When the bag empties, this method instantiates all 7 Brick types (I, J, L, O, S, T, Z) and uses Collections.shuffle(List) to randomize them.

      Returns:
      a single Brick from the current bag.

    • fillQueue

      private void fillQueue()
      Ensures the nextBricks queue always contains enough pieces to satisfy the UI preview requirements (defined by PREVIEW_COUNT).

    • getBrick

      public Brick getBrick()
      Retrieves the next brick for gameplay.

      This method removes the head of the preview queue and immediately triggers a refill to maintain the look-ahead buffer.

      Specified by:
      getBrick in interface BrickGenerator
      Returns:
      the Brick to be spawned on the board.

    • getUpcomingBricks

      public List<Brick> getUpcomingBricks()
      Provides a read-only snapshot of the upcoming pieces.

      Used by the GameRenderer to draw the "Next" sidebar. The returned list is a copy, so modifying it does not affect the actual generator state.

      Specified by:
      getUpcomingBricks in interface BrickGenerator
      Returns:
      a list of the next PREVIEW_COUNT bricks.
